comments.comment: Hi! thanks for your contribution!, great first issue!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AmitMY>@AmitMY</denchmark-link> can you please share example code or is it happening also on our examples? UPDATE: able to replicate with CPU example, duplicating lines from 86%

Hi, I would like to know if this is still an issue for you. I am running the latest version of PyCharm and it works fine. I also observed this issue before and what helped was going to "Run Configurations" -> "Emulate terminal in output console".

Thanks, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awaelchli>@awaelchli</denchmark-link>
In run configuration under execution, If I have this setup: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5757359/80952175-eec1a100-8e01-11ea-8eac-36e2a40a427c.png></denchmark-link>
I get: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5757359/80952558-832c0380-8e02-11ea-8a89-7945d306934b.png></denchmark-link>
Meaning, I now don't have many rows after 70%, but rather 3 rows instead of 1 for each epoch. I upgraded PyCharm to 2020.01, I got the same result.
Turn on "emulate terminal in output console". It's a PyCharm issue.

My apology, but I actually can't find that option anywhere. Tried looking online, it doesn't show. Where did you set that up? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5757359/80979454-0879dd00-8e30-11ea-9daf-3935e581fcd1.png></denchmark-link>

I have it right there under "Execution", but it seems it is only showing up if configured with local interpreter. You have setup a remote interpreter. <denchmark-link:https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/360007040860-No-Emulate-terminal-in-output-console-option-in-PyCharm-for-Windows>https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/360007040860-No-Emulate-terminal-in-output-console-option-in-PyCharm-for-Windows</denchmark-link>
